title: England 6-11 Scotland: Watch highlights as Scotland win at Twickenham for first time in 38 years
description: Watch highlights of Scotland's historic 11-6 victory over England as they win at Twickenham for the first time since 1983.

title: Saharan dust: Orange skies and sandy snow in southern Europe
description: The sky in parts of southern Europe turns an eerie orange as wind brings sand from the Sahara desert.

title: UK weather: 'Beast from the East Two' to bring snow, ice and floods
description: The cold snap will not be as extreme as in 2018, forecasters say, but will cause disruption this weekend.

title: Coronavirus: Vaccine chief 'optimistic' about over-50s May target
description: Dr Clive Dix adds that the UK is "ahead of the game" in terms of anticipating coronavirus variants.

title: Government plans to reverse Cameron NHS reforms
description: The plans, revealed in a leaked document, would reverse controversial changes made by David Cameron.

title: Croydon stabbings: One killed and nine injured in spate of attacks
description: Police are called to four reports of stabbings in Croydon, Chislehurst and Wandsworth.

title: England in India: Joe Root's double century keeps England in command in Chennai
description: Joe Root scores an imperious double century as England continue their strong start to the first Test against India on day two in Chennai.

title: Biden: 'Erratic' Trump should not get intelligence briefings
description: President Joe Biden said Mr Trump "might slip and say something" if given access to state secrets.

title: Christopher Plummer: Hollywood pays tribute to 'one of the greats'
description: The Oscar winner, who has died aged 91, is praised as "an extraordinary man" and "consummate actor".

title: Why are people counting stars this week?
description: Experts want to get an accurate picture of light pollution levels by encouraging people in the UK to count the stars wherever they live.

title: Myanmar coup: Internet shutdown as crowds protest against military
description: The national blackout comes amid the biggest protest so far against this week's military takeover.

title: Jackie Weaver 'chuffed' to be meeting Strictly star
description: Jackie became an internet sensation after a video recording of her parish council meeting went viral.

title: Super Bowl 2021: Patrick Mahomes v Tom Brady - Jason & Osi analyse the quarterbacks
description: The NFL Show's Jason and Osi preview the battle between quarterbacks Patrick Mahomes and Tom Brady ahead of Sunday's Super Bowl between Kansas City Chiefs and Tampa Bay Buccaneers.

title: Upright buzzer aims to tackle lockdown slouching
description: The Upright buzzer vibrates when the wearer slouches, to encourage them to sit up straight.

title: Woman found dead in Birmingham after dog attack
description: The dog, believed to be a Staffordshire cross, has been handed over to police

title: The Dig: Archive shows real-life archaeologist from Netflix film
description: A 1965 interview shows Basil Brown, the Sutton Hoo discoverer played by Ralph Fiennes in The Dig.

title: Laughter and loss: One street's Covid-19 stories
description: The personal accounts of how the pandemic has changed life in one road in Bristol.

title: Phil Foden: Manchester City & England midfielder wants to spend entire career with club
description: England midfielder Phil Foden tells Football Focus he hopes to stay at Manchester City for his entire career.

title: How will we heat homes in zero carbon Britain?
description: Will hydrogen or heat pumps be able to replace gas central heating?

title: Extreme E: Jenson Button says future of motorsport will always be electric
description: Former Formula 1 world champion Jenson Button, who will compete in the new Extreme E racing series for his own team, says the future of motorsport "will always be electric".

title: The Papers: Pubs 'may open in April' and summer holiday hopes
description: The front pages look at how lockdown restrictions might be eased in the coming months.

title: Topshop Oxford Street: 'I was in absolute awe at the size of the place'
description: Six millennials lament the loss of the Oxford Street Topshop, which will not reopen after lockdown.

title: Covid PPE: How healthcare workers came to feel 'expendable'
description: Almost a year in to the pandemic, concerns remain over personal protective equipment.

title: Covid: Vaccine tensions stoke German criticism of EU's von der Leyen
description: Ursula von der Leyen admits mistakes were made in the EU's vaccine strategy as Germans question the rollout.

title: Myanmar coup: What now for Aung San Suu Kyi?
description: The pro-democracy leader remains hugely popular at home but has lost favour on the world stage.

title: Parosmia: 'The smells and tastes we still miss, long after Covid'
description: A small proportion of people who've had Covid end up with a scrambled sense of smell and taste. Here 13 explain what they miss most.

title: Coronavirus in Tanzania: The country that's rejecting the vaccine
description: Tanzania is promoting herbal treatments while denying that there are any coronavirus cases.

title: Week in pictures: 30 January - 5 February 2021
description: A selection of striking images taken around the world this week.

title: The world's deepest dive
description: In 1960 two engineers became the first people to ever dive 11km to the bottom of the Mariana Trench.

title: Amanda Gorman effect: 'It's going to open doors for poets'
description: From the inauguration to the Super Bowl, the poet's performances bring attention to the art form.

title: Project 17: 'I was told to clean my own school toilets'
description: Yolanda, 17, is campaigning for better education and more resources for schools in South Africa.

title: Swiss women only got the right to vote 50 years ago. Why?
description: Women in Switzerland were finally granted the right to vote after a referendum in February 1971.

title: Top London surgeon tackles Covid 'vaccine hesitancy' in minority communities
description: Martin Griffiths is working hard to get more people from ethnic minority communities vaccinated.
